item.description:
Directions:

1. If you are on I-93 in Manchester take exit 7 to get onto NH-101 E heading     towards Auburn/Portsmouth.

2.Take exit 1 for NH Bypass 28 toward I-93/Auburn/Hooksett.    0.3 mi

3. Turn right onto Londonderry Turnpike.                                    0.2 mi

(If you are on NH-101 W take a left at end of exit 1 off ramp.)

4. Enter the Manchester Traffic Circle taking the 3rd exit            0.1 mi

5. Continue onto NH-121S/Manchester Rd going past

Sandy's Variety Store to your right                                            1.3 mi

6. You will pass a place where there is nothing to your right but the lake. Then you will cross over a small bridge.  At 1.3 miles just past the bridge, park at the pull out on your right or close by.  The gated fire road is on the right.

If you are using a GPS 360 Manchester Road, Auburn, NH was the closest house to the parking area and this house was opposite the moored sailboats during the summer.

These trails are on the opposite side of Lake Massabesic across from Battery Point.  From Battery Point one can see the ledges we will be hiking to and beyond.  From the top of the ledges are some nice views of the lake and a few mountains as well.  There are more places the dogs can access the water on this hike than on the Battery Point side of the lake. Although the trails are some what hilly this should be an easy hike for most people.

The length of the hike is approximately 1.7 miles one way, so about 3.4 miles round trip. Near the turnaround point there is an easier way to come back on fire roads if the group chooses not to hike back along the shore.

As the Lake is a public water supply you could get a fine if your dog is caught in the water by a Warden.

So everyone is covered by the liability waiver any guest you want to bring should sign up as a member to come on the hike. Minors would need a waiver signed by a parent/guardian.

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Park along side the road where Fire Road 55 starts, there is a pull out there and also nearby on other parts of the road.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Last Minute Hike - Lake Massabesic Trails - The Ledges and Beyond
